snippet: Three trucks carrying supplies for NATO troops crossed a border post in southwestern Pakistan on Thursday, the first to do so in seven months, officials said.
abstract: First trucks carrying supplies for NATO troops in Afghanistan cross the southwestern border post at Chaman in Pakistan, after a hiatus of seven months; Pakistan agreed to reopen NATO supply routes after Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton apologized for the deaths of 24 Pakistani soldiers who were killed in an American airstrike along the Afghanistan-Pakistan border in November 2011.
lead_paragraph: Three trucks carrying supplies for NATO troops crossed a border post in southwestern Pakistan on Thursday, the first to do so in seven months, officials said.

headline.seo: NATO Supply Trucks From Pakistan Resume Trek to Afghanistan
headline.main: NATO Supply Trucks From Pakistan Resume Trek to Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: NATO Trucks From Pakistan Resume Trek to Afghanistan
